```{r, message = FALSE}
# Load libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(stringr)
source("helper.R")
```

```{r}
# Read in raw data from the rev survey. These are the files downloaded from survey monkey saved as a .csv
raw_data_rev <- read.csv("data/rev_nat.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
```

```{r}
# Pull out all responses for Q88 (a single selection question), combine, then determine 'question n'
Q88 <- "What.is.your.age..in.years.."

Q88_rev <- get_single_selection(data = raw_data_rev, q.name = Q88)

Q88_all <- rbind(Q88_rev)

number_of_people <- length(unique(Q88_all$id))
```

```{r}
#Optional Filtering Step
sixty_plus <- Q88_data %>% 
  filter(response %in% c("60-69", "70+"))

thirty_sixty <- Q88_data %>% 
  filter(response %in% c("30-39", "40-49", "50-59"))

under_thirty <- Q88_data %>% 
  filter(response %in% c("21-29"))
```

```{r}
# Manipulate data into a graphable format
Q88_plot <-
  Q88_all %>%
  group_by(response, ) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  mutate(percent_all = count / sum(count))
```

```{r}
# Plot with percents and response counts
r <- 
  ggplot(Q88_plot, aes(x = response, y = count)) +
  geom_bar(stat = 'identity') +
  geom_text(aes(label= paste(round(percent_all,2), count, sep = "***")))

r
```

```{r}
# Save graph as PNG, plot data as csv, and all question data including response IDs as csv (save question n and N at end of plot file as "_x.x")
ggsave(filename = 'rev_q88_age.png', plot = r, device = 'png')

write.csv(Q88_plot, 'rev_q88_age_17.csv', row.names = FALSE)

write.csv(Q88_all, 'rev_q88_age_ids.csv', row.names = FALSE)
```
